docs.text: Elsewhere Entities as Lenders Pact Summoning functions like supernatural credit: - You receive power now - You pay with your core later - Interest accrues (the more you use, the faster you pay) - Default is impossible (the entity always collects) Substitution as Currency Cores are fungible. The entity doesn't care whose core it gets. This creates: - Substitution markets : Where cores are bought and sold - Core brokers : Middlemen connecting those with cores to sell and summoners needing payment - Substitution pricing : Heavy patterns worth more, light patterns worth less - Procurement operations : Acquiring cores through various means (legal and otherwise) The Substitution Hierarchy From most to least valuable: 1. Exceptional patterns (seventh son of seventh son, etc.) 2. Heavy patterns from powerful lineages 3. Standard adult patterns 4. Light adult patterns 5. Child patterns (potential not yet realized) 6. Elderly patterns (mostly spent) 7. Animal patterns (weak, but abundant) This is a price list for souls. It exists. People consult it.
docs.title: The Pact Economy

docs.text: Many positions require specific pattern profiles: Explicit Requirements - "Must have Court-Field or Heights-Field classification" - "No Wound-Self or Shard-Self candidates" - "Minimum Road-Path or Ladder-Path trajectory" Implicit Screening Even without stated requirements, hiring decisions incorporate pattern data: - "We don't discriminate based on pattern—we just look at the whole candidate" - "Their pattern doesn't fit our company culture" - "The Loom predicts retention issues with that profile"
docs.title: Pattern-Gated Careers

docs.text: Certain pattern-combinations are associated with professions: "Lamplighters" (Lantern-Road-Pact-Duty-Court) - Bureaucrats, administrators, reliable employees - Boring but dependable - Automatically considered for stable positions "Storm-Children" (Spark-Crossroads-Twin-Rebel-Wild) - Artists, adventurers, troublemakers - Exciting but unreliable - Automatically excluded from positions requiring stability "Knot-Born" (Wound-Maze-Thorn-Fear-Street) - Criminals, laborers, expendables - Dangerous but useful - Automatically considered for dangerous or demeaning work These stereotypes become self-fulfilling. Denied legitimate opportunity, the Knot-Born turn to illegitimate work. Their criminal records confirm The Loom's predictions. The cycle continues.
docs.title: Pattern Families and Stereotypes

docs.text: Pattern Segregation Different patterns concentrate in different industries: - Heights-Field patterns in management - Forge-Field patterns in manufacturing - Street-Field patterns in informal economy - Underbelly-Field patterns in criminal enterprise This isn't natural sorting—it's structural channeling. Each pattern is directed toward "appropriate" work from Binding Day onward. Wage Differentials Same work, different pay, based on pattern: - Pattern-privileged workers paid more (justified as "retention cost") - Pattern-constrained workers paid less (justified as "risk premium") - The gap is legal, documented, defended as actuarially sound
docs.title: Labor Markets

docs.text: Pattern Residue is produced when patterns dissolve—primarily at death. Natural Production - Every death releases some Residue - More from heavy patterns - More from traumatic deaths - More from pattern-rich populations Sites of Concentration - Battlefields (mass death, often violent) - Plague zones (mass death, weakened patterns) - Execution grounds (controlled, harvestable) - Disaster sites (concentrated mortality) Manufactured Production The demand for Residue creates incentives: - War as industry (mass death with geographic concentration) - Plague management (letting disease run for harvest) - Capital punishment as production (not justice, but fuel) - Blood sports (entertainment plus Residue)
docs.title: Production

docs.text: Harvesting Licensed harvesters extract Residue from death sites. Unlicensed harvesters do the same, illegally. Equipment required: - Collection apparatus (varies by tradition) - Storage containers (keeping Residue stable) - Transportation (Residue degrades; speed matters) Occupational hazards: - Exposure effects (too much contact changes you) - Competition (other harvesters, scavengers, authorities) - Moral weight (you're literally profiting from death) Refinement Raw Residue requires processing for most uses: - Purification (removing contaminants) - Stabilization (extending shelf life) - Concentration (increasing potency) - Packaging (making it tradeable) Refineries are industrial operations—factories of death-product. Distribution Residue reaches end users through: - Official channels (licensed trade, taxation, regulation) - Gray markets (legal but questionable sourcing) - Black markets (illegal, untaxed, often higher quality) Pricing Residue prices fluctuate based on: - Supply (peace = scarce; war = abundant) - Quality (pure vs. contaminated) - Source (some deaths produce better Residue) - Demand (more practitioners = higher prices) During prolonged peace, prices spike. Some institutions have incentives to prevent peace from lasting.
docs.title: The Residue Trade

docs.text: Who Benefits From Death The Loom (fuel for operation) Core Binders (fuel for anchors) Residue traders (profit margin) Magitech industries (raw material) Anyone using Residue-powered devices Who Provides Death The pattern-constrained (dying in wars, plagues, prisons) The poor (selling Residue rights for cash now) The condemned (executed for production) Populations deemed "surplus" The economy of Hálcova is built on bodies. Clean hands are expensive. Everyone is complicit at some remove.
docs.title: The Moral Economy

docs.text: Characteristics - Born with or drawn into favorable patterns - The Loom predicts success; institutions deliver it - Low interest rates, good jobs, favorable treatment How They Stay Privileged - Marry within pattern-class (maintaining lineage patterns) - Leverage pattern-capital into actual capital - Use wealth to insulate from pattern-deviation consequences - Support institutions that validate pattern-prediction Their Perspective - "The system works—look at my success" - "Pattern-discrimination is just actuarial accuracy" - "If their patterns predicted better, they'd do better"
docs.title: The Pattern-Privileged

docs.text: Characteristics - Born with or drawn into unfavorable patterns - The Loom predicts struggle; institutions ensure it - High interest rates, bad jobs, hostile treatment How They Stay Constrained - Denied opportunity that might disprove predictions - Forced into circumstances that confirm predictions - Accumulate debt, criminal records, health problems - Each confirmation further constrains next generation Their Perspective - "The system is rigged—look at my constraints" - "They decided what I'd be before I could decide anything" - "Success despite pattern proves nothing; they just call it deviation"
docs.title: The Pattern-Constrained

Applications - Pattern-engines (The Loom and derivatives) - Communication systems (pattern-resonance transmission) - Transportation (Residue-fueled vehicles for high-priority use) - Manufacturing (certain processes require Residue catalyst) - Weapons (Residue-enhanced ammunition, siege equipment)

docs.text: Industries dependent on Residue form a political bloc: - They need steady supply (war, plague, execution) - They oppose peace when it threatens supply - They support policies that produce harvestable death - They lobby against restrictions on harvesting This isn't conspiracy—it's interest group politics. The people running these industries aren't monsters. They're responding to incentives. The incentives produce monstrous outcomes.

The work confirms their patterns, trapping them further.

docs.text: Religion in Hálcova: Faith and Fate Overview Religion in Hálcova is inseparable from fate. The Sórscad pattern is not just a predictive framework—it's the primary evidence of divine existence. Something assigns patterns. Something makes predictions accurate. Something answers when The Loom queries. That something is worshipped, feared, manipulated, and denied in various ways. But it is never ignored. The Core Theological Question What is Fate? All religions in Hálcova grapple with this. The answers vary, but the question is universal: Is Fate a conscious entity with will and purpose? Is Fate an impersonal force, like gravity or time? Is Fate many entities, or one entity with many faces? Is Fate the same as the Elsewhere, or something that contains or transcends it? Is Fate benevolent, malevolent, or indifferent? The evidence is ambiguous. The Loom works. Predictions come true. Something responds to ritual. But what it wants, why it responds, and whether it cares about human wellbeing—these remain contested. The Orthodoxy: The Church of the Weaver Orthodox Core Beliefs The dominant religious framework across most of Hálcova. The Weaver ( A Szövő ) is: The divine pattern-maker who creates all Sórscads The source of The Loom's accuracy The author of fate, whose design is perfect even when painful Neither purely benevolent nor malevolent— necessary Doctrine : The Pattern Is Sacred : Your Sórscad is your divinely-assigned role. It reflects The Weaver's purpose for you. Acceptance Is Virtue : Embracing your pattern, even its hardships, is holy. Resistance creates suffering. The Loom Is True : The Loom reads The Weaver's will accurately. Trust its predictions. Deviation Is Sin : Acting against your pattern wounds the cosmic design. Enforcement is medicine, not punishment. The Design Serves : The Weaver's plan serves existence itself, not individual happiness. Your suffering has purpose you cannot see. Orthodox Practices The Drawings : Natal and Binding draws are religious ceremonies, not just administrative procedures. Priests conduct them. Families gather. The revelation of pattern is considered a holy moment. Pattern-Prayer : Daily meditation on your Sórscad. Contemplating its meaning, accepting its implications, aligning will with fate. Correction Rituals : When you've acted against pattern, confession and ritual penance. Overseen by priests, recorded in temple registers. Death Rites : Ensuring proper Pattern Residue release. Prayers for the Léilcrù to return cleanly to The Weaver's design. Orthodox Structure Temples at every significant settlement Priests trained in theology and basic pattern-reading Bishops overseeing regional temples The High Weavery : Central authority, located at the Great Node The Synod : Overlapping governance with the Warden Order Who Believes This (Orthodox) The pattern-privileged (the system validates them) Those raised in Orthodox communities Those who find comfort in cosmic purpose Institutions that benefit from pattern-enforcement The Appeal Orthodoxy offers: Meaning (your suffering has purpose) Community (shared belief and practice) Structure (clear rules and expectations) Comfort (fate is in capable hands) For people whose patterns predict good outcomes, this is easy faith. For those whose patterns predict hardship, it's harder—but some find peace in submission. The Threadist Reformation: Fate as Collaboration Threadist Core Beliefs A reform movement within Orthodoxy that takes a different view of deviation. Key Difference : The Weaver is not finished weaving. Fate is still being created. Your choices participate in the design. Doctrine : The Pattern Is Draft : Your Sórscad is a starting point, not a sentence. The Weaver offers threads; you help weave. Deviation Is Data : When someone acts against pattern, it might be error—or it might be new information. The design evolves. Fate Threading Is Collaboration : The Art isn't theft from fate—it's working with unfinished material. Threaders are co-creators. The Loom Predicts, Not Prescribes : Accuracy reflects current patterns, not fixed destiny. Change the patterns, change the predictions. Agency Is Sacred : Free will is The Weaver's gift, not its enemy. Choosing is how we participate in creation. Threadist Implications Threadists: Accept Fate Threading as legitimate (with ethical constraints) View enforcement with suspicion (forcing patterns may be anti-divine) See deviation as potentially holy (revelation of new design elements) Believe The Loom should inform, not control Who Believes This (Threadists) Fate Threaders seeking religious justification Pattern-constrained seeking hope for change Intellectuals uncomfortable with determinism Reformers within Orthodox institutions Orthodox Response to Threadists The Orthodoxy considers Threadism heresy: "The design is complete. Claiming otherwise is pride." "Agency serves the pattern, not the reverse." "Threadist doctrine justifies sin and chaos." Threadists are tolerated in some regions, persecuted in others. The Warden Order considers them ideologically dangerous. The Hollow Saints: Fate as Prison Hollow Saint Core Beliefs A heretical movement that inverts Orthodox values entirely. Core Insight : The Sórscad is a cage. The Weaver is a jailer. True freedom comes from escaping your pattern entirely. Doctrine : Fate Is Bondage : Patterns are chains. Predictions are control. The Loom is a surveillance apparatus. The Weaver Is Enemy : Whatever assigns patterns does not have human interests at heart. Worship is collaboration with your oppressor. Elsewhere Is Escape : Selling your core to Elsewhere entities isn't damnation—it's liberation. They're taking you out of the cage. The Absent Are Saints : The Elsewhere faction that wants nothing —they represent true freedom. No pattern, no prediction, no control. Emptiness Is Peace : The consumed—those whose cores are fully paid—are not victims. They're free. The husk left behind isn't a tragedy; it's a chrysalis. Hollow Saint Practices Pact Encouragement : Hollow Saint communities help members make pacts. They provide information on entities, facilitate contacts, support those paying their debts. Substitution Ethics : Unlike casual pact-users, Hollow Saints have complex ethics around substitution. Some refuse it entirely (liberation should be chosen). Others permit it for the unwilling (freeing them from patterns they hate). The Empty Honored : Those fully consumed are celebrated. Their remains are treated with reverence. They escaped. Proselytization : Spreading the truth about Fate's prison nature. Recruiting those most oppressed by their patterns. Who Believes This (Hollow Saints) Pact Summoners seeking ideological framework The pattern-condemned who've given up on Orthodox comfort Those who've watched loved ones consumed and need meaning Anti-institutional radicals Orthodox Response to Hollow Saints The Orthodoxy considers this satanic heresy: "They worship demons and call it freedom." "The consumed aren't free—they're destroyed." "This cult leads people to eternal annihilation." The Warden Order hunts Hollow Saints aggressively. The cult operates in secret, recruitment happens quietly, and practicing openly means death. The Fleshwright Materialists: Fate as Biology Fleshwright Core Beliefs A philosophical-religious position emerging from Flesh Shaping traditions. Core Insight : The pattern isn't divine—it's biological. The Sórscad is legible because bodies are predictable. There is no Weaver. There is only meat. Doctrine : Patterns Are Organic : The Sórscad reads biological tendencies—brain structure, hormonal predisposition, physical capacity. Calling this "divine" is superstition. Prediction Is Statistics : The Loom works because large populations behave predictably. This isn't fate—it's probability. Homunculi Prove It : Flesh Shapers create life without patterns. If fate were real, they couldn't. The fact that homunculi exist outside The Loom shows the system is physical, not metaphysical. Liberation Through Construction : The goal is to build beings entirely outside pattern . Not escaping fate—transcending the biological substrate that makes prediction possible. Whatever Answers The Loom is not divine. It's something that reads biology. Understanding what it is (probably Elsewhere, probably interested in Pattern Residue) demystifies the entire system. Fleshwright Implications Fleshwrights: Practice Flesh Shaping as philosophical statement Seek to create pattern-free life View The Loom as technology, not religion Want to understand the Attendance scientifically Who Believes This (Fleshwrights) Flesh Shapers with intellectual ambitions Materialist philosophers Scientists studying pattern-biology Anti-religious secularists Orthodox Response to Fleshwrights Fleshwrights are considered dangerous atheists: "They deny the sacred to excuse their abominations." "Their constructs are hollow precisely because they lack divine pattern." "Calling the Attendance 'technology' is willful blindness." Fleshwrights aren't persecuted as violently as Hollow Saints (they're not recruiting the desperate to suicide-by-pact), but they're excluded from respectable society in Orthodox regions. The Colony Cults: Fate as Composite Colony Cult Core Beliefs Religious movements centered on fungal colony symbolism and practice. Core Insight : Individual patterns are fragments of a larger whole. The colonies remember older, deeper patterns. True fate isn't personal—it's collective. Doctrine : The Great Network : Before individuals, there was connection. The original pattern was One, not many. Separation is the wound. Colonies Remember : Ancient fungal networks carry patterns older than The Loom, older than the Orthodoxy. They know what fate was before it was divided. Hosting Is Reunion : Taking a colony into yourself is rejoining the original pattern. Your individual Sórscad becomes part of something larger. Death Serves Life : When colonies consume the dead, they preserve patterns that would otherwise dissipate. This is holy recycling, not desecration. The Old Ones : The most ancient colonies, passed through generations, may themselves be divine. Or at least more divine than The Weaver, who only divides. Colony Cult Practices Communal Infection : Deliberate colony-sharing within cult communities. Everyone carries the same strain; everyone is connected. Ancestor Incorporation : Feeding the colony deceased cult members. They persist in the network's memory. Not bound like echoes— integrated . Network Communion : Group rituals where hosts link through their colonies. Shared sensation, shared memory, something like shared consciousness. Fruit Offerings : Summoning constructs from colony-memory as offerings to the network itself. Returning patterns to the collective. Who Believes This (Colony Cults) Colony Hosts seeking spiritual framework Communities where hosting is traditional Those who've experienced network-communion and found it meaningful Those seeking alternative to individualistic fate-models Orthodox Response to Colony Cults Colony Cults are considered primitive and dangerous: "They worship parasites and call it communion." "Their 'memories' are contaminated, not sacred." "Infection-spreading is assault, not religion." Colony Cults exist in legal gray zones. Hosting itself may be legal; deliberate infection is not. Cults that stay private are tolerated. Cults that proselytize are persecuted. The Ancestor Speakers: Fate as Conversation Ancestor Speaker Core Beliefs Religious traditions centered on Core Binding as ancestral communion. Core Insight : Your pattern includes everyone who came before. The dead aren't gone—they're waiting to be heard. Binding is not imprisonment; it's invitation. Doctrine : The Pattern Is Genealogy : Your Sórscad carries traces of ancestral patterns. You are your lineage speaking through new flesh. The Dead Advise : Properly bound echoes aren't prisoners—they're advisors. They see what you cannot. They know what you haven't learned. Binding Is Dialogue : The relationship between binder and echo should be collaborative. Listen to them. Honor them. Release them when the conversation is complete. The Loom Sees Surface : Pattern-prediction captures tendencies, not depths. The ancestors see depths. Both are needed. Death Is Transition : The dead move from speaking to spoken-to. Binding maintains their voice in the world. Release returns them to the greater conversation. Ancestor Speaker Practices Ancestral Binding : Deliberately binding family dead for guidance. Sometimes for generations. Echo Council : Group decision-making that includes bound ancestors. The living propose; the dead advise. Binding Ethics : Strict rules about who can be bound (family only, or with permission), how they should be treated (respect, not command), and when to release (when the conversation ends). Pattern Reading : Interpreting current Sórscads through ancestral context. "Your Wound-Self echoes your grandmother's; let's ask her about it." Who Believes This (Ancestor Speakers) Core Binders from traditional lineages Communities where binding is ancestral practice Those who've had meaningful echo relationships Those seeking ethical framework for binding Orthodox Response to Ancestor Speakers Ancestor Speaking is the most tolerated heterodoxy: "At least they honor the dead, in their way." "The errors are containable within proper binding law." "Better this than the Hollow Saints." In practice, Ancestor Speakers often coexist with Orthodoxy. They attend Orthodox temples, participate in Orthodox rites, and quietly maintain their echo-relationships at home. The Warden Order monitors but rarely persecutes. Common Themes Across All Faiths The Loom's Accuracy Is Accepted No tradition denies that predictions work. They disagree about: Why they work (divine vs. biological vs. Elsewhere) Whether they should work (fate as good vs. fate as control) What to do about it (accept vs. resist vs. escape vs. transcend) Something Answers All traditions acknowledge that something responds to The Loom's queries. They disagree about: What it is (Weaver vs. Elsewhere vs. technology vs. network) What it wants (cosmic design vs. Pattern Residue vs. unknown) Whether to serve it, use it, or escape it Death Matters Pattern Residue, core harvesting, and what happens when patterns dissolve—all traditions have positions: Orthodox: return to The Weaver's design Threadists: pattern continues influencing unfinished design Hollow Saints: liberation from pattern Fleshwrights: biological decay, nothing more Colony Cults: preservation in the network Ancestor Speakers: transition to advisory role Individual vs. Collective Fate The tension between personal pattern and collective destiny runs through everything: Orthodox: individual patterns serve collective design Threadists: individual choices shape collective future Hollow Saints: escape is individual; liberation is personal Fleshwrights: transcendence is biological, not spiritual Colony Cults: individual is illusion; collective is truth Ancestor Speakers: individual is genealogy speaking Religious Geography Orthodox Dominance The Core regions, major cities, centers of power. Temples everywhere. Warden Order presence. Pattern-enforcement integrated with governance. Heterodox Pockets Frontier regions, traditional communities, places where Orthodox reach is weak. Various heresies coexist, sometimes in the same village. Underground Hollow Saints, radical Fleshwrights, aggressive Colony Cults. Operating in secret even in Orthodox heartland. Networks of the desperate and the convicted. Contested Regions where multiple traditions compete openly. Religious conflict overlapping with political conflict. Conversion and counter-conversion. Outstanding documentation Specific religious calendars and festivals Priestly hierarchies Seminary training Interfaith relations Historical religious conflicts

docs.text: A philosophical-religious position emerging from Flesh Shaping traditions. Core Insight : The pattern isn't divine—it's biological. The Sórscad is legible because bodies are predictable. There is no Weaver. There is only meat. Doctrine : Patterns Are Organic : The Sórscad reads biological tendencies—brain structure, hormonal predisposition, physical capacity. Calling this "divine" is superstition. Prediction Is Statistics : The Loom works because large populations behave predictably. This isn't fate—it's probability. Homunculi Prove It : Flesh Shapers create life without patterns. If fate were real, they couldn't. The fact that homunculi exist outside The Loom shows the system is physical, not metaphysical. Liberation Through Construction : The goal is to build beings entirely outside pattern . Not escaping fate—transcending the biological substrate that makes prediction possible. Whatever Answers The Loom is not divine. It's something that reads biology. Understanding what it is (probably Elsewhere, probably interested in Pattern Residue) demystifies the entire system.

docs.text: Religious movements centered on fungal colony symbolism and practice. Core Insight : Individual patterns are fragments of a larger whole. The colonies remember older, deeper patterns. True fate isn't personal—it's collective. Doctrine : The Great Network : Before individuals, there was connection. The original pattern was One, not many. Separation is the wound. Colonies Remember : Ancient fungal networks carry patterns older than The Loom, older than the Orthodoxy. They know what fate was before it was divided. Hosting Is Reunion : Taking a colony into yourself is rejoining the original pattern. Your individual Sórscad becomes part of something larger. Death Serves Life : When colonies consume the dead, they preserve patterns that would otherwise dissipate. This is holy recycling, not desecration. docs.text: The Warden Order: Enforcers of Fate Overview The Warden Order ( Őrvonalak —"Guardian Lines") is the enforcement arm of Loom orthodoxy. They are investigators, hunters, judges, and executioners rolled into one—a zealot force dedicated to ensuring that Fate's predictions come true and that no one escapes their pattern. They are, in essence, the Loom's police. But "police" doesn't capture the theological dimension. To the Wardens, deviation from pattern isn't crime. It's heresy. It's cosmic disorder. It's a wound in reality that must be cauterized. Purpose and Mandate The Problem They Solve The Loom's predictions are accurate—but not perfectly accurate. Deviations occur: Someone predicted for a Road-Path career pivots unexpectedly A Blade-Hálmaht pattern survives past their statistical death-window A Knot-Born pattern achieves what their family should have prevented A Core Binder escapes their bleed-trajectory through unknown means A Pact Summoner pays their debt early through suspicious circumstances Most deviations are noise. Some are environmental factors The Loom missed. But some—the ones that matter—represent deliberate manipulation. Pattern-Fraud : Misrepresenting your Sórscad to gain advantage. Pattern-Evasion : Deliberately acting against your pattern. Pattern-Manipulation : Attempting to change your pattern through magic or ritual. Pattern-Interference : Helping others evade or manipulate their patterns. The Warden Order exists to detect, investigate, and punish these crimes against Fate. The Theological Mandate To the Orthodox faithful, your Sórscad is your divinely-assigned role in existence. Deviation is not just illegal—it's an assault on cosmic order. Deviation creates ripples that damage the design Enforcement is not punishment—it's correction They are not cruel—they are necessary Structure and Organization The Ranks Initiates ( Kezdők ) Trainees undergoing Loom-attunement Not yet granted enforcement authority Assist full Wardens in investigations High washout rate (many cannot handle the attunement) Wardens ( Őrök ) Full enforcement authority Licensed to investigate, arrest, and judge minor deviations Operate individually or in pairs Most common rank; the ones civilians encounter Priors ( Előjárók ) Supervisory rank overseeing multiple Wardens Authority over major deviation cases Can convene judgment tribunals Often stationed at major Loom-Nodes Calculators ( Számítók ) Specialized analysts who interpret Loom data Identify patterns of deviation across populations Predict where manipulation is likely occurring Rarely operate in the field; their work is in the archives High Wardens ( Főőrök ) Regional commanders Direct authority over all enforcement in their territory Answer only to the Synod Political as well as religious figures The Synod ( Zsinat ) Governing council of the Order Seven High Wardens plus the Loom-Keeper General Sets enforcement policy and theological interpretation Meets at the Great Node in [capital city TBD] The Attunement Wardens are not simply trained. They are attuned —connected to The Loom in a way that grants them abilities beyond normal Loom-Keepers. The Process : Conducted at a major Loom-Node Involves extended contact with a pattern-engine The initiate opens themselves to the Attendance Something is exchanged—given and received Those who survive are changed What Attunement Grants : Pattern-Sight : Wardens can see Sórscad patterns without mechanical assistance. Not complete readings—impressions, dominant circles, deviations from expected behavior. Deviation-Sense : A feeling—almost physical—when someone nearby is acting against their pattern. Like hearing a wrong note in a familiar song. Loom-Voice : The ability to query The Loom mentally, receiving basic information about a subject's pattern and prediction-status. Limited range, requires concentration. Thread-Touch : In physical contact, a Warden can feel someone's fate-weight. How heavy their pattern is, how much remains, how much has been spent or sold. What Attunement Costs : Pattern-Lock : An attuned Warden's own Sórscad becomes fixed. They cannot deviate from their own pattern without experiencing severe dissonance. They are bound to their fate more tightly than any civilian. Resonance : Wardens feel deviations as personal discomfort. A city full of pattern-fraud gives them migraines. Proximity to heavy manipulation can be physically painful. Connection : The Attendance is always there, in the back of their minds. Not controlling—observing. Some Wardens describe it as a patient presence. Others as a weight they can never put down. Life-Debt : Attunement shortens life. The connection draws on vital energy. Most Wardens don't reach old age. They burn out, consumed by the link that gives them power. The Attendance: What Wardens Serve The Open Secret Wardens know that something answers when they use their abilities. They don't call it The Weaver—that's for civilians. Among themselves, they use the same term as senior Loom-Keepers: The Attendance . Most Wardens believe The Attendance is: An aspect of the divine Weaver A messenger or servant of Fate The voice of the pattern itself, given presence Some Wardens suspect: The Attendance is an Elsewhere entity Their attunement is a pact they didn't fully understand They're serving something with its own agenda This suspicion is not heresy—it's occupational hazard. Wardens spend their lives detecting manipulation. Some start to wonder if they're being manipulated themselves. The Relationship The Attendance: Provides information when Wardens query Guides attention toward significant deviations Offers... suggestions. Urges. Directions that feel like their own ideas. Never forces action. Always presents as assistance. Rewards success with a sense of rightness, harmony, completion. Responds to failure with... nothing. Silence. Which somehow feels worse. The most dangerous Wardens are the ones who've stopped questioning whether their judgment is their own. Methods and Practices Investigation Detection : Loom-data analysis (Calculators identify statistical anomalies) Pattern-Sight (Wardens scanning crowds for deviation-impressions) Informants (the Order has networks in every district) Tip-lines (civilians reporting suspicious pattern-behavior) The Attendance (sometimes it simply... directs attention) Verification : Registry check (confirming recorded Sórscad) Prediction-review (what should this person be doing?) Outcome analysis (what are they actually doing?) Pattern-reading (direct examination by attuned Warden) Interrogation (what do they know, and how do they know it) Arrest and Detention Wardens have broad authority: Can detain anyone for pattern-verification Can enter premises where deviation is suspected Can compel testimony from civilians Can hold suspects indefinitely pending investigation Limitations : Cannot execute without judgment (except immediate threat) Cannot detain the pattern-privileged without Prior authorization Cannot operate outside their territorial jurisdiction Cannot interfere with other Loom-Keeper operations In practice, limitations are flexible. Wardens have significant discretion. Abuse is common, especially against the pattern-constrained who have no advocates. Judgment Minor Deviations : Judged by the arresting Warden Sentences: fines, pattern-counseling, restricted movement, labor assignment No appeal to higher authority Recorded in subject's Registry file Major Deviations : Judged by Prior tribunal Sentences: imprisonment, pattern-modification attempt, indentured service, execution Limited appeal to High Warden Permanent Registry marking Extraordinary Deviations : Judged by High Warden or Synod directly Reserved for: practitioners, nobility, institutional actors, mass manipulation Sentences: public execution, family-pattern marking, institutional dissolution No appeal Execution Methods The Order believes execution should serve Fate, not just end a life. Pattern-Severance : The condemned's Sórscad is ritually dissolved before death. They die without a pattern, without a core to bind, without anything to sell to Elsewhere. Complete annihilation. Fate-Feeding : The condemned is killed in a way that maximizes Pattern Residue harvest. Their death serves The Loom directly. Their pattern-energy fuels the system that caught them. Public Correction : Traditional execution with public announcement of deviation type. Educational function—showing civilians what happens to pattern-evaders. Specializations The Orthodoxy Wardens Standard enforcement. Investigate deviation, arrest offenders, pass judgment. The most common type, the ones civilians know. The Calculator Corps Analysts who never leave the archives. They read data patterns, identify manipulation signatures, predict where deviation will occur. They direct field Wardens to targets. The Echo-Hunters Specialize in Core Binding violations. Track illegal echo-harvesting, pattern-balancing operations, Registry manipulation through echo-contamination. They carry their own echoes—captured from previous targets. The Flesh-Finders Specialize in Flesh Shaping violations. Hunt unlicensed Shapers, mimic-makers, blood-sourcing operations. They understand homunculi well enough to identify them on sight. The Pact-Breakers Specialize in Elsewhere-related violations. Extremely dangerous work. Track illegal pact-brokers, investigate substitution schemes, handle cases where Elsewhere interference is suspected. Some have made their own pacts, using the enemy's tools against them. The Thread-Cutters Specialize in Fate Threading violations. Hunt threaders who've pulled without license, extracted selves operating independently, fate-speculators manipulating pattern-markets. They're attuned to spot narrowed fate-webs. The Spore-Burners Specialize in Colony Hosting violations. Track feral colonies, illegal infection operations, hosts operating outside registration. They carry antifungal compounds and know how to identify contaminated pattern-readings. The Warden's Dilemma The Theology of Enforcement If Fate determines everything, how can anyone deviate? If deviation is impossible, why do Wardens exist? The Orthodox Answer : Deviation is part of Fate too The Weaver allows deviation so that correction can occur Wardens are fated to catch deviants The system is self-consistent if you don't think too hard The Uncomfortable Truth : If Wardens are fated to catch deviants, are deviants fated to deviate? If so, is punishment just? They couldn't help it. If not, then Fate doesn't determine everything. And the whole system is in question. Most Wardens don't think about this. The ones who do either leave the Order or become its most zealous members—doubling down to escape the doubt. The Selection Problem The Order recruits based on pattern. Wardens tend to have patterns that include: Duty-Drive (obligation) Hunt-Path (pursuit) Chain-Bond (service) Threshold-Death (violence-adjacent mortality) These patterns create good enforcers. They also create people predisposed to: Following orders without question Pursuing targets with obsessive focus Accepting hierarchical authority Being comfortable with violence The Order selects for zealotry. This is intentional. An Order full of questioners wouldn't function. The Attunement Trap Once attuned, Wardens can't really leave. Pattern-Lock means they'll feel wrong doing anything else Resonance means they'll feel deviations everywhere they go Connection means The Attendance is always watching Life-Debt means they're already dying; might as well serve The Order doesn't need to threaten defectors. The attunement is the chain. Walk away, and you spend your shortened life feeling wrong about everything, with something patient watching your failure. Some walk away anyway. They don't last long. Public Perception Among the Faithful Wardens are holy warriors. Protectors of cosmic order. Stern but necessary. You thank them for their service even as you hope never to meet one. Among the Pattern-Privileged Wardens are useful tools. They keep the system running, enforce the rules that benefit the privileged. Occasionally inconvenient when they enforce rules without regard for status—but usually manageable. Among the Pattern-Constrained Wardens are terror. They arrive, they accuse, they judge. Your word against theirs. Your pattern against The Loom's prediction. You're guilty before investigation begins because your pattern says you should be guilty. Among Practitioners Wardens are occupational hazard. Every practitioner of the Five Arts operates in gray zones. The Order is always watching. The question isn't whether you're violating something—it's whether you're violating something they care about this month. The Order and the Elsewhere The Uncomfortable Parallels The Warden attunement looks, to outside observers, remarkably like a pact. Exchange of something (pattern-lock) for power Ongoing connection to an external entity Shortened lifespan Guidance that feels like your own thoughts Difficulty leaving the relationship The Order insists this is different: The Attendance is divine, not demonic Attunement serves Fate, not a faction's agenda Wardens maintain free will (they just choose correctly) The cost is sacrifice, not transaction Critics note: "Divine" and "Elsewhere" aren't mutually exclusive Agenda opacity doesn't mean agenda absence "Choosing correctly" and "compulsion" look the same from outside Sacrifice and transaction are both exchanges The Accountants Theory Some scholars note that The Attendance behaves remarkably like The Accountants—the Elsewhere faction obsessed with debts, ledgers, and balance. Pattern-enforcement ensures debts are paid Deviation-correction maintains balanced ledgers The Loom's predictions are contracts reality must honor Wardens are collection agents If true, this means: The entire Orthodox system serves an Elsewhere agenda Wardens are pact-bound and don't know it The Order is the largest Elsewhere cult in existence "Fate" is a brand name for a specific faction's influence This theory is heresy. It's also unfalsifiable. And it keeps certain people awake at night. Terminology Reference Term Pronunciation Meaning Őrvonalak OOR-voh-nah-lahk The Warden Order ("Guardian Lines") Őrök OO-ruhk Warden (standard rank) Előjárók EH-loy-yah-rohk Prior (supervisory rank) Számítók SAH-mee-tohk Calculator (analyst specialization) Főőrök FOO-uh-ruhk High Warden (regional command) Zsinat ZHEE-naht The Synod (governing council) Attunement — The process of connecting a Warden to The Loom Pattern-Lock — Warden's inability to deviate from their own pattern Deviation-Sense — Ability to feel when others act against pattern Thread-Touch — Ability to feel fate-weight through contact Pattern-Severance — Execution method dissolving condemned's Sórscad Fate-Feeding — Execution method maximizing Residue harvest Outstanding documentation Specific Warden case procedures Territorial jurisdictions Relationship with secular authorities Known defector accounts Historical Order formation

docs.text: The Order recruits based on pattern. Wardens tend to have patterns that include: Duty-Drive (obligation) Hunt-Path (pursuit) Chain-Bond (service) Threshold-Death (violence-adjacent mortality) These patterns create good enforcers. They also create people predisposed to: Following orders without question Pursuing targets with obsessive focus Accepting hierarchical authority Being comfortable with violence The Order selects for zealotry. This is intentional. An Order full of questioners wouldn't function.
docs.title: The Selection Problem

docs.text: Once attuned, Wardens can't really leave. Pattern-Lock means they'll feel wrong doing anything else Resonance means they'll feel deviations everywhere they go Connection means The Attendance is always watching Life-Debt means they're already dying; might as well serve The Order doesn't need to threaten defectors. The attunement is the chain. Walk away, and you spend your shortened life feeling wrong about everything, with something patient watching your failure. Some walk away anyway. They don't last long.
docs.title: The Attunement Trap

docs.text: Wardens are holy warriors. Protectors of cosmic order. Stern but necessary. You thank them for their service even as you hope never to meet one.
docs.title: Among the Faithful

docs.text: Wardens are useful tools. They keep the system running, enforce the rules that benefit the privileged. Occasionally inconvenient when they enforce rules without regard for status—but usually manageable.
docs.title: Among the Pattern-Privileged

docs.text: Wardens are terror. They arrive, they accuse, they judge. Your word against theirs. Your pattern against The Loom's prediction. You're guilty before investigation begins because your pattern says you should be guilty.
docs.title: Among the Pattern-Constrained

docs.text: Wardens are occupational hazard. Every practitioner of the Five Arts operates in gray zones. The Order is always watching. The question isn't whether you're violating something—it's whether you're violating something they care about this month.
docs.title: Among Practitioners

docs.text: The Warden attunement looks, to outside observers, remarkably like a pact. Exchange of something (pattern-lock) for power Ongoing connection to an external entity Shortened lifespan Guidance that feels like your own thoughts Difficulty leaving the relationship The Order insists this is different: The Attendance is divine, not demonic Attunement serves Fate, not a faction's agenda Wardens maintain free will (they just choose correctly) The cost is sacrifice, not transaction Critics note: "Divine" and "Elsewhere" aren't mutually exclusive Agenda opacity doesn't mean agenda absence "Choosing correctly" and "compulsion" look the same from outside Sacrifice and transaction are both exchanges
docs.title: The Uncomfortable Parallels

docs.text: Some scholars note that The Attendance behaves remarkably like The Accountants—the Elsewhere faction obsessed with debts, ledgers, and balance. Pattern-enforcement ensures debts are paid Deviation-correction maintains balanced ledgers The Loom's predictions are contracts reality must honor Wardens are collection agents If true, this means: The entire Orthodox system serves an Elsewhere agenda Wardens are pact-bound and don't know it The Order is the largest Elsewhere cult in existence "Fate" is a brand name for a specific faction's influence This theory is heresy. It's also unfalsifiable. And it keeps certain people awake at night.
docs.title: The Accountants Theory
